intro: Soliva mutisii, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces tendrils that help it climb and support its growth. Soliva mutisii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types make it a resilient and adaptable species.
